reviewText: In order to get a high-paying job, Beverly Dngelo bluffs her way into a nanny's position. SHe never mentions her ex-con days as a thief. But when  she's had time alone, she decides to sell the kids. Only nobody wants the  little monsters who have plans for Bev too! It's fun, light laughs, good  family flick.
I am so happy I finally have this movie after all these years

This movie is hilarious.  Beverly D'Angelo nails the role of the crazy drunk ex con babysitter.  I had several laugh out loud moments while watching!  If you like Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead or the Home Alone movies you will like.  this is a highly underrated film!
Nice to buy good and cheap movies.
One of the funniest movies ever with he best cast ever from Carol Kane to Beverly D'Angelo you will laugh and cry and Lisa Kudrow in one of her earliest roles as a talk show host.
I'm in it as the body-builder sitter so I am biased.  My kids love seeing their mom and it's a fun reminder of my past life.  Enjoy!
I did not comploetely see all of this because it was so poorly acted and so much rediculous sterotyped footage that I stopped and gave it to my grandaughter who loved it.  Go figure.

The Crazysitter is, simply put, "the greatest film of all time."  If you are asking yourself, "Should I, a lover of quality cinema, own The CrazySitter?," then your answer is absoloutly.  The performances by themselves would be enough to earn the "two-thumbs up" it received from Ebert, but when combined with masterful direction and stunning cinematography it rivals Citizen Kane.  Michael McDonald, from Revenge of the Nerds 3 fame, has given us a chilling, lurid tale of betrayal, lust, and seduction.  Fun for the whole family.
